abstract: Or does one person ultimately have to have final say?
snippet: Or does one person ultimately have to have final say?
lead_paragraph: As Sarah Max reports in an article we’ve just published, Mark McDonald and Josiah Humphrey started developing and optimizing websites as teenagers, skipped college and started their web and mobile app company, Appster, in 2011. They eschewed outside funding and put what little money they had into office space, setting up shop in downtown Melbourne, Australia, right next to Google and IBM. And then they settled into their shared role as chief executive officers.

headline.main: Do You Think Co-C.E.O.s Can Work?
